creator: gmaloon@metro.co.za
text: getRemoteHost returns the ip address even though enableLookups="true"

The getRemoteHost() method will return IP addresses (instead of host names) if 
DNS cannot be accessed.  What happens when you write a simple application that 
tries to call InetAddress.getHostName()?

Also, are you using Tomcat stand-alone or going through one of the web 
connectors?  If the latter, which version?
creator: craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
craig.mcclanahan@sun.com
text:
One more thing to double check -- do you have resolveHosts="true" in your 
<Valve> definition for the access log valve?  This is not the default.

See the Server Configuration Reference for details on all the valid settings.

creator: gmaloon@metro.co.za
text:
I am running standalone.

InetAddress.getLocalHost().getHostName() returns the hostname.

I set resolveHosts="true", but the acess log still shows ip addresses as well 
as the getRemoteHost

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
After checking the code, you need to set both :
- enableLookups="true" on the connector
- resolveHosts="true" on the valve
for that to work. Unfortunately, none of my computers have a valid reverse DNS,
so I can't really confirm it does work.

The setting on the valve is a bit redundant, so maybe we should remove it.
